docs.abstract: As concerns about growth and privacy issues took a toll, technology and banking stocks led a slide in Europe, and futures indicated that markets in the United States could follow.
docs.snippet: As concerns about growth and privacy issues took a toll, technology and banking stocks led a slide in Europe, and futures indicated that markets in the United States could follow.
docs.lead_paragraph: Apple was worth more than $1 trillion at the start of November. Now, it’s valued at $880 billion.

headline.main: Amazon, Apple and Facebook Once Led the Market. Now They Are Driving It Down.
headline.print_headline: Tech Stocks Dive As Wall St. Loses Gains for Month

docs.abstract: Apple is closing a technological loophole that let authorities hack into locked iPhones, infuriating law enforcement officials and reigniting a debate over security versus privacy.
docs.snippet: Apple is closing a technological loophole that let authorities hack into locked iPhones, infuriating law enforcement officials and reigniting a debate over security versus privacy.
docs.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — Apple has long positioned the iPhone as a secure device that only its owner can open. That has led to battles with law enforcement officials who want to get information off them, including a well-publicized showdown with the F.B.I. in 2016 after Apple refused to help open the locked iPhone of a mass killer.

headline.main: Apple to Close iPhone Security Hole That Law Enforcement Uses to Crack Devices
headline.print_headline: Apple to Plug IPhone Port, Hiding Data From Police

docs.abstract: Apple posted a $14 billion profit thanks higher prices for its products. But it will stop reporting how many products it has sold.
docs.snippet: Apple posted a $14 billion profit thanks higher prices for its products. But it will stop reporting how many products it has sold.
docs.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — Since Apple introduced the iPhone 11 years ago, smartphones have become ubiquitous, and the market for them is saturated. To maintain growth, Apple has employed a shrewd strategy: Charge more for the devices.

headline.main: Apple Raises Prices, and Profits Keep Booming
headline.print_headline: Charging  More Helps Apple Bolster Bottom Line

docs.abstract: A boom in artificial intelligence research has drawn the tech industry’s biggest companies and their checkbooks to the storied English city.
docs.snippet: A boom in artificial intelligence research has drawn the tech industry’s biggest companies and their checkbooks to the storied English city.
docs.lead_paragraph: CAMBRIDGE, England — When you step off the train here and walk into the city square outside the railway station, you will not see the spires of King’s College Chapel or the turrets atop the Trinity Great Court. The University of Cambridge is still a cab ride away. But you will see a stone and glass office building with a rooftop patio. This is where Amazon designs its flying drones.

headline.main: Silicon Valley’s Giants Take Their Talent Hunt to Cambridge
headline.print_headline: Tech Makes Cambridge Its Go-To For Talent

byline.original: By Cade Metz and Adam Satariano

docs.abstract: Powered by sales of its iPhone X, the tech giant reported another strong quarter and defied fears that consumers wouldn’t buy the pricey devices.
docs.snippet: Powered by sales of its iPhone X, the tech giant reported another strong quarter and defied fears that consumers wouldn’t buy the pricey devices.
docs.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — Since Apple said in January that it would  bring back most of the $252 billion it held abroad under the new tax law, investors have wondered what the company would do with the enormous cash pile. On Tuesday, those investors learned that they are in line for a big chunk of the money.

headline.main: Apple Says It Will Buy Back $100 Billion in Stock
headline.print_headline: Apple, Awash in Cash, Buys Back More Stock

docs.abstract: The two tech giants settled a seven-year legal fight, concluding a series of battles over smartphone patents with little to show for them.
docs.snippet: The two tech giants settled a seven-year legal fight, concluding a series of battles over smartphone patents with little to show for them.
docs.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — The smartphone patent wars are finally over.

headline.main: Apple and Samsung End Smartphone Patent Wars
headline.print_headline: After 7 Years, Apple and Samsung Settle Conflict Over Smartphone Patents

docs.abstract: In his final State of the Art column, Farhad Manjoo reflects on the industry’s changes and presents a new guide for navigating the future of technology.
docs.snippet: In his final State of the Art column, Farhad Manjoo reflects on the industry’s changes and presents a new guide for navigating the future of technology.
docs.lead_paragraph: Nearly five years ago, in my very first State of the Art column, I offered a straightforward plan for how to survive what was shaping up to be a turbulent time in the tech world.

headline.main: How to Survive the Next Era of Tech (Slow Down and Be Mindful)

docs.abstract: BMW and Mercedes-Benz rebuffed Apple’s overtures for a self-driving car partnership, according to people familiar with the talks.
docs.snippet: BMW and Mercedes-Benz rebuffed Apple’s overtures for a self-driving car partnership, according to people familiar with the talks.
docs.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — Apple once had grand aspirations to build its own electric self-driving car and lead the next generation of transportation. Over time, the tech giant’s ambitions ran into reality.

headline.main: Apple, Spurned by Others, Signs Deal With Volkswagen for Driverless Cars
headline.print_headline: Volkswagen to Join Apple For Autonomous Project

docs.abstract: Definers, an import from Washington to Silicon Valley, thrived with opposition research and a fishy campaign to push Apple’s C.E.O. for president.
docs.snippet: Definers, an import from Washington to Silicon Valley, thrived with opposition research and a fishy campaign to push Apple’s C.E.O. for president.
docs.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — When Tim Miller, a longtime Republican political operative, moved to the Bay Area last year to set up a public relations shop, he brought with him tradecraft more typical of Washington than Silicon Valley.

headline.main: How Facebook’s P.R. Firm Brought Political Trickery to Tech
headline.print_headline: How Trickery Became Part Of Playbook For Big Tech

docs.abstract: Talks between TV and movie writers and their agencies on a new code of conduct broke off before a midnight deadline. “It has become clear a big change is necessary,” the Writers Guild of America said.
docs.snippet: Talks between TV and movie writers and their agencies on a new code of conduct broke off before a midnight deadline. “It has become clear a big change is necessary,” the Writers Guild of America said.

headline.main: Hollywood Upended as Unions Tell Writers to Fire Agents
headline.print_headline: Fire Agents, Union Urges The Writers In Hollywood
